Interface_name: WebSocket Client-side based on browser native API in JavaScript
Instruction:
Task Description: Implement a WebSocket client class in JavaScript that establishes multiple WebSocket connections for different binary data types (byte array, byte buffer, and input stream) and handles their communication events.

Class Description: The WebSocketClient class manages three WebSocket connections for different binary data types. It initializes connections, sets binary data types, handles connection events (open, message, error), and provides methods for sending binary data and displaying communication status.

Attributes:
- websocketByteArray: [WebSocket] - WebSocket connection for byte array data
- websocketByteBuffer: [WebSocket] - WebSocket connection for byte buffer data
- websocketInputStream: [WebSocket] - WebSocket connection for input stream data
- output: [HTMLElement] - DOM element for displaying communication logs

Methods:
- constructor() -> [void] - Initializes WebSocket connections and event handlers
- initializeEventHandlers() -> [void] - Sets up event handlers for all WebSocket connections
- onOpenByteArray(evt: [Event]) -> [void] - Handles byte array connection open event
- onOpenByteBuffer(evt: [Event]) -> [void] - Handles byte buffer connection open event
- onOpenInputStream(evt: [Event]) -> [void] - Handles input stream connection open event
- echoBinaryByteArray() -> [void] - Sends binary data as byte array
- echoBinaryByteBuffer() -> [void] - Sends binary data as byte buffer
- echoBinaryInputStream() -> [void] - Sends binary data as input stream
- onMessageByteArray(evt: [MessageEvent]) -> [void] - Handles received byte array messages
- onMessageByteBuffer(evt: [MessageEvent]) -> [void] - Handles received byte buffer messages
- onMessageInputStream(evt: [MessageEvent]) -> [void] - Handles received input stream messages
- onError(evt: [Event]) -> [void] - Handles WebSocket errors
- writeToScreen(message: [string]) -> [void] - Displays messages in the output element
